title: Landing Page Hero
subtitle: A hero section based on Poppr's website
description: Exploration in text splitting effects, cursor following animations, and 3D transforms. All made with GSAP.
keywords: landing page, hero section, gsap, text splitting, cursor driven animation, 3d transforms

title: Apple Watch Gestures
subtitle: Inspired by Apple's Watch Series 9
description: A simple demo of Apple's watch gestures from their website.

title: Parallax Seasons
subtitle: An interactive exploration of the seasons
description: One of my most popular projects on Codepen, this is a simple parallax effect that I created using just HTML, CSS, and JS. The effect is triggered when the user moves their mouse across the screen. By default, the season on desplay is the current one in the United States üá∫üá∏ (as of right now that is <SEASON>). However, users can change the season by clicking on the menu. This was my entry to getting highly featured on the Codepen trending page and newsletter ‚ù§Ô∏è.

title: Parallax Devices
subtitle: Flow from Device to Device
description: This project was insired by Nate Smith's portfolio website. My goal was to create a parallax effect, transitioning one device üì± to another üíª. GSAP timelines are used to animate the entire flow.
keywords: parallax, devices, demo, ios, macos, apple tv, iphone, macbook

title: Photography View Transitions
subtitle: View Transitions API
description: My entry for a small competition on X/Twitter. The goal was to create a view transition effect for a social media-inspired design.
keywords: view transitions, photography, demo, social media, x/twitter, react, tailwindcss, framer motion

title: Sticky Notes
subtitle: A simple sticky notes app
description: A simple sticky notes app that allows you to add, edit, and delete notes. It uses local storage to save the notes and has realistic animations to make it feel more interactive.
keywords: sticky notes, app, demo, local storage, interaction design, post-it notes

title: About Me
subtitle: Gibson Murray - Front-End Developer
description: Hello world! I'm Gibson, a front-end developer with a passion for creating beautiful and functional web applications. I am currently working on exploring new front-end technologies and frameworks like Vue and Nuxt.
keywords: about me, portfolio, resume, front-end developer, web developer, web applications, front-end technologies, front-end frameworks, vue, nuxt

title: Dune Thumper
subtitle: Dune: Part 2 - inspired scene
description: It is a 2D scene with a thumper hitting the ground, and aworm ü™± that emerges in the background. The animations and the scene are all made with pure HTML and CSS üò±
keywords: dune, thumper, worm, 2d, scene, animation, html, css

title: Trashy Photos
subtitle: Throw them away!
description: I wanted to challenge myself by recreating Emil Kowalski's demo of deleting photos in a stylish way. I only used GSAP ü™Ñ to create the animations. This is all done with vanilla JavaScript. I did not like doing it in vanilla JS, but I wanted to see how far I could get without tools like React ‚öõÔ∏è
keywords: photos, trash, delete, style, gsap, vanilla javascript, demo, interaction design

title: Jumpy Cards
subtitle: Watch them bounce!
description: A very simple project with a few cards that jump on launch. Mimics AirBnB's micro-interactions as seen on their app. It uses a simple GSAP tween used to stagger the scales of the cards.
keywords: cards, bounce, airbnb, micro-interactions, gsap, vanilla javascript, demo, interaction design

title: Pressure Grid
subtitle: Feeling the pressure?
description: This emulates a touch-sensitive pad that can be used to control different things. On touch release a crosshair of cells will meet at the point of release.
keywords: pressure, grid, touch, sensitive, pad, control, gsap, vanilla javascript, demo, interaction design

title: iPhone Widget Flood
subtitle: A widget flood like no other
description: A very simple scroll animation that scales cards from behind an iPhone 14 Pro.
keywords: iphone, widget, flood, scroll, animation, gsap, vanilla javascript, demo, interaction design

title: iPad Parallax Scroll
subtitle: Bringing an iPad to life
description: This is one of my first featured projects on Codepen. It is a small project designed to gain more experience with GSAP and to learn how to create a scrolling effect.
keywords: ipad, parallax, scroll, animation, gsap, vanilla javascript, demo, interaction design

title: Magic Terminal
subtitle: The Future Awaits
description: Imagine a Bash shell with knowledge of the universe and the future of what is to come... ‚ú® The Magic Terminal is an interactive <CodepenLink /> built with hidden lore. It will answer your questions but sometimes it reveals a bit more than you asked for.

title: Olympic Medals
subtitle: Winners of the 2024 Olympics
description: An interactive widget built with React and Framer Motion that displays the number of medals won by the top 4 countries during the 2024 Olympics in Paris, France.
keywords: olympics, medals, 2024, paris, france, react, tailwindcss, framer motion, demo, interactive, awards, widgets
